Modern medicine and healthcare too often emphasize “health” over “care,” focusing more on treatments and medications than on the human aspect of care. As patients, we have few opportunities to show our appreciation for the doctors who help us during challenging times.

“Thanks doc!” is multimedia art installation taking viewers on a symbolic journey of care and gratitude, and highlighting the impact of caring for others by sharing knowledge and showing compassion. The piece uses actual words of thanks that patients have shared with doctors, demonstrating the often unspoken appreciation we feel for the doctors who help us overcome adversity and tend to us when we need it most.

The series of 18 panels (above) combines images of doctors with thank-you notes from patients. The installation was first displayed at the Stanford MedicineX Conference at the Stanford School of Medicine on September 29–30, 2012.
Artists: Ron Gutman and Kathleen Donahue

As a patient consulting with doctors on HealthTap, you agree to engage with the practitioner in a respectful and appropriate manner. You agree to refrain from using inappropriate language and/or behavior.
You agree that you may not make demands for treatment in a consultation. Please understand that there are three types of virtual consults on HealthTap:

Standard virtual consults: In these consults, doctors who have accepted you as a patient (whether for “on call” care, unless you already have an ongoing care relationship with the doctor) can provide care. You may receive an examination (within the limits of virtual care), provide a medical history, obtain an assessment from a physician, and receive a treatment plan as determined to be medically appropriate by the consulting doctor.

Introductory Consult: this is the first interaction with a new doctor or a doctor who has not yet accepted you as a patient on HealthTap. An introductory consult is not intended for the doctor to give you care. Introductory consults are for providing you with information or get to know the doctor and to determine if she or he can help you with your health concern (in person and/or through virtual consults). A doctor may need to invite you to her or his office for an in person appointment in order to accept you as a patient on HealthTap.

Second opinion consult: this is a consult in which a doctor can provide you with information about a health issue or a second opinion on a prior diagnosis. A new diagnosis, treatment, or other care are not available in a second opinion consult.

HealthTap is intended to give you easy access to health information (and even care) on your computer or mobile device. As a HealthTap patient (with a HealthTap Prime membership or other access to consulting doctors on HealthTap), you are entitled to receive medically necessary and appropriate care, and you agree not to abuse or overuse the access to doctors provided to you. Overuse includes requests for multiple opinions on single medical condition HealthTap consults should not be used : to obtain numerous opinions on a single medical condition. In general, doctors may discourage this practice and may be hesitant to provide an assessment to those patients who attempt to seek multiple consults. In cases where there is an absolute medical necessity, it may be appropriate to do more than one consult in a day about a specific health issue, but you may also need to consider seeking in-person care or emergency services if the level of severity truly is at the point where multiple consults are warranted (especially if in-person care is recommended by a consulting doctor on HealthTap).

Even if you believe you need a prescription or lab test, you should not expect a prescription or lab test order from any given consult. Patients who are located outside the U.S. may receive prescription recommendations only; lab orders are not currently possible for patients located outside the U.S. If the practitioner deems it appropriate to prescribe treatment or order lab tests for the condition discussed in a virtual consult, then the prescription or lab test(s) may be ordered by the physician. Lab tests are currently ordered using Quest Diagnostics lab test services; it may not be possible to order all of Quest Diagnostics lab tests (if any) in all U.S. states at this time. . The following medication categories cannot be prescribed or recommended in virtual consults on HealthTap: DEA category I-IV medications, lifestyle medications (such as weight loss or hair loss medication), and U.S.-state regulated medications. It may be possible to get prescriptions for some psychiatric medications in HealthTap Concierge virtual consults, but doctors cannot prescribe psychiatric medications in HealthTap Prime virtual consults.

trans-unit.source: There are cases when you may present with a condition that is long-standing for which you may have been taking a prescription for a long period of time. Even in this situation, it is up to the consulting doctor’s medical expertise and discretion to decide to order that prescription and for what duration. Please understand that in HealthTap Prime virtual consults, you and the doctor most likely do not have an established doctor-patient relationship, and best practice will be for the doctor to prescribe (if at all) a short-course of medication to hold you over until you are able to consult with your established doctor.

For the first month of your full-price paid subscription only, you have a 72-hour grace period to notify HealthTap Support in writing if you do not want to continue the subscription and/or to request a refund of your first month’s full-price subscription fee. This grace-period does not apply if you have engaged in one or more consults after the free-trial period. You may cancel your subscription at any time, and your subscription will be valid through the then current pre-paid month. HealthTap does not offer partial-month refunds.

HealthTap Prime offers primary-care consults from specific physicians on HealthTap only. Consults for specialist care are not available on HealthTap Prime. HealthTap Prime consults are available under an “on call” model where you will be connected with the first-available HealthTap Prime physician. If you wish to or do select a specific doctor (including specialists) to consult, these consults are part of the HealthTap Concierge service, are not included in your HealthTap Prime subscription, and are subject to additional per-consult fees. HealthTap Prime may not cover the cost of consults that originated from searching for a specific doctor or specialty. Pricing for any Concierge consults will be shown prior to initiating such consults and by participating in such a consult you agree to pay the fees associated with such a consult.

Top doctors on HealthTap can now give you their opinion about your regular doctor’s assessment of your health problem and how to treat it. Second opinions can help you make a more informed decision about your care.

As a patient, one of your most important rights is to get a second opinion about your diagnosis and treatment options. Being informed is a vital part of choosing a treatment. Good doctors understand the importance of being well informed and support a second opinions.

About the reviews & methodology

With more than 65,742 doctors in HealthTap’s Medical Expert Network, we have 1,623,598 years of clinical experience on tap. We have asked our doctors to use this experience to rate the effectiveness and clinical usefulness of thousands of medications for medical conditions and other indications.
The result: HealthTap RateRx, the world’s first (and only) large-scale doctor rating of the effectiveness of drugs and treatments.

A new, independent resource for doctors and patients alike, RateRx presents ratings of medication effectiveness as reported by thousands of U.S.-licensed doctors in clinical practice in more than 137 specialties. RateRx is the first national survey of U.S.-licensed doctors, soliciting independent feedback from physicians across the country about their real-world clinical experience treating a broad range of common conditions, and rating the medications used in those treatments. RateRx represents the first comprehensive assessment of what experienced clinicians in each specialty actually use in the care of patients with specific conditions. Unlike other studies, which may report on the clinical effectiveness of treatments under controlled circumstances, RateRx calls on the deep, long-term, real-world experience of top doctors to reveal which treatments doctors have learned actually work with patients.
The RateRx study was conducted by HealthTap. HealthTap collects extensive information from doctors on, among other topics, the treatments of all health-related issues.

Doctors were asked to rate the clinical effectiveness of a drug for treating a condition on a scale of 1 to 5 stars. Based on their knowledge from clinical experience using the drug for that indication, contributing doctors were instructed to rate medications for their use with specific indications. The combined ratings for each treatment have been summarized into an aggregate rating that reflects doctors’ collective experiences. The profiles of all doctors who provided ratings are publicly visible, and anyone can review details of the doctors’ training and experiences, including their specialties and board certifications.

Participation in this study was open to all U.S.-licensed doctors in good standing. More than 567,000 doctors were invited to participate in the study (includes more than 67,000 doctors in the HealthTap Medical Expert Network plus 500,000 U.S.-licensed doctors in HealthTap’s extended doctor community). In addition to those doctors invited to contribute to the study, any U.S.-licensed doctor in good standing was eligible to participate by submitting a request to HealthTap.

Doctors could rate any medication for its effectiveness in treating any condition. For common conditions, medications known to be treatments for the conditions were presented alongside the conditions. Doctors could add ratings for any new medication treatments not already included in the list.

RateRx results display each treatment for an indication in an ordered rank, based on average weighted ratings, from highest-rated to lowest, and only when there are sufficient data for a meaningful weighted average. The weighted average takes into account both the average rating and the number of ratings, discounting higher average ratings that are based on a smaller number of assessments.

To ensure unbiased doctor evaluations, doctors do not see their colleagues’ existing contributions until after they have entered their own rating. Recommendations cannot be changed once submitted, but after ratings are submitted, doctors can view the ratings of other doctors and comment on these. Both patients and doctors can learn from the RateRx ratings system. Patients benefit from the collective wisdom shared by these doctors, enabling them to see how different treatments for the same conditions are rated and reviewed. Doctors benefit from their colleagues’ ratings and comments, and are able to interpret them by referring to the contributing doctors’ practice profiles (which show their education and experience, their specialty training, years in practice, DocScore, and their "Known-for" topics).

Comments, which are optional, are often used by doctors to qualify or explain ratings, or to share details of how medications are used for each indication. Comments are available to read and review, but do not change the numeric value of the rating.

Ratings are based on generic drug names, but brand names are presented to permit doctors to rate specific drugs. Brand names are shown for every generic medication name presented. This study does not differentiate ratings between different brand names for the same medication.

The most common medication treatments for each condition are listed for ratings, but doctors were encouraged to add treatments for any indication, ensuring the inclusion of new or novel treatments for each condition. Doctors were instructed to add medications not previously on the list of standard treatment only if they had experience using the medication to treat the condition at issue and found these medication effective in the treatment of that condition.

RateRx is a living work. As an open and ongoing feature on the HealthTap platform, any U.S.-licensed doctor in good standing can contribute to this data at any time. RateRx data reflect the ongoing feedback and ratings provided by doctors based on their real-world use of medications in treating patients, serving as a unique, continuously updated resource for the efficacy of both existing and new treatments.

A difference of less than 0.5 stars between treatments may not be statistically significant or meaningful. Differences of greater than 0.5 stars between two treatments displayed are always statistically significant. The weighted average rating is a Bayesian estimate of the true average rating, given the observed ratings so far. The formula combines the global mean rating (3.3 stars) with the observations as follows:
(r = estimate of average rating, q = number of ratings, μ = average of the observed ratings):

Your Profile contains the information you provide when you create a HealthTap account, including your name, email address and date of birth. You can add optional health information to your Profile, like personal data, health goals, medications, conditions, and other information, which helps to personalize your HealthTap experience. You choose what health information to add to your Profile through using HealthTap and adding information to your Profile.

Yes, you can add, edit or delete optional information appearing in your Profile at any time. You can edit, but not remove, certain information (like an email address) required for login and to use HealthTap, and doctor consult notes. You have a "right to amend" your health records and can add information to your consult notes or health record to make it more accurate or complete, or have a disagreement with noted in your health record, or update other profile information by submitting a request to HealthTap support (by phone, secure online form submission or email).

On HealthTap other members and doctors cannot see your Profile or the health information in it. When using HealthTap Prime or Concierge, health information from your Profile and basic information about you (such as your real name and age) are visible to the doctors with whom you consult.

You can manage the communications you receive from HealthTap, including emails, under your account Settings. Additionally, you can opt out of receiving most emails by selecting the unsubscribe link at the bottom of any email, and opt out of mobile messages by replying "STOP" to any message. You can update your communications details and preferences at any time in your account Settings.

We use information collected through your use of HealthTap to provide you with information about our current or future services, to enable the services we provide, and otherwise as described in this Privacy Statement. This Privacy Statement describes the ways that we use or disclose your information. In support of these uses, we may use personal information to:
No. Your identity is safe with us and is not for sale. We do not sell Personally Identifiable Information.

Aggregated information is information from multiple members that is not associated with any individual user account; statistics are summaries of information, not associated with any individual user account; de-identified data does not include Personally Identifiable Information. Aggregated information and de-identified data and statistics are used to run and improve the services provided on or through HealthTap. This information may also be used by us or provided to our partners for purposes of research and analysis.

Yes, you can share certain information from HealthTap using sign-in services social media services such as Facebook and Twitter. Please consider any impact on your privacy and anonymity when posting content to public services. Content posted to these services will be governed by the respective privacy policies of those services.

Like most online services, HealthTap uses cookies. All browser cookies we use are encrypted. We use session ID cookies and persistent cookies to enable you to sign in and to help personalize HealthTap for you. Using cookies simplifies the delivery of relevant content and allows you to retrieve information you previously provided making use of HealthTap features easier. We link the information we store in session cookies to personally identifiable information you submit while on HealthTap. You have the ability to accept or decline cookies. Most web browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can usually modify your browser setting to decline some or all cookies if you prefer. If you choose to decline all cookies, you may not be able to use interactive features of HealthTap or other websites that depend on cookies.

HealthTap or the Medical Experts on HealthTap may provide you with information about external service providers ("External Service Providers") that may be of interest or use to you. HealthTap does not provide these External Service Providers with any Personally Identifiable Information about you, without your express consent.
You may reach us by contacting our support team via email or you may write to us at our most current address. Please see our

We value your privacy. This Privacy Statement describes how we will protect and handle the personal information that you provide to us through our web, mobile and related services. Among other things, the HealthTap Privacy Statement explains:
When we say we care about your privacy, we mean it. Privacy policies are important documents, but many people don't read them because they are too long, are confusing, or are written in 'legalese.'

Because of this, we’ve designed our Privacy Statement with our members in mind, creating links to the most common questions members may have about the site and how it works where privacy issues may be involved. We’ve also written everything in plain, understandable language.
that describes our core beliefs about privacy and your core rights as a user of our site. These documents are located on our

Yes. Your use of HealthTap is anonymous. Your real name, date of birth, email address, and other Personally Identifiable Information are not visible on the site to other members. You select a name under which you appear when using the Site (a Public Profile Name). You can stay anonymous by selecting a confidential Public Profile Name and by keeping that private. HealthTap uses bank-level security and encryption. More about our security measures can be found

Yes. Your email address is not displayed in your Public Profile, and is never visible to other members on HealthTap. For more information about how we keep your Personally Identifiable information safe and secure, see
Yes. Your account and Health Activity information are secure and password protected.

Yes. You can close your account at any time by signing into your HealthTap account and choosing “Delete Account” from your Account Settings. You will receive an email confirming that your account has been deleted.

HealthTap allows members to “connect with” doctors. HealthTap does not reveal your real name or any other Personally Identifiable Information to doctors when you Follow or Connect with them. If you request a Private Conversation with an expert on HealthTap, and an expert accepts this request, your name and Health Activity will be visible to that expert.

Yes. After you sign up for HealthTap, we will send you a message welcoming you to our community and thanking you for joining us. After that, HealthTap may occasionally send messages on the HealthTap message system or to an email address you provide to us. No one likes Spam, so we do not send our members Spam. As described elsewhere in this Privacy Statement, HealthTap may also send you notifications (which you can turn off) and important messages to the email address listed in your Account Settings.

Yes. While HealthTap does not monitor the information exchanged in Direct Messages/Private Conversations, HealthTap doctors are required to keep these communications confidential and private, much like they would for an in-person doctor-patient interaction.

Questions and answers on HealthTap are for general education and information. Only general, informational questions are permitted. For specific, personal health questions, always ask your own doctor or healthcare provider. (HealthTap Medical Experts are not your personal doctor or healthcare provider, and their answers to questions are not personal or for personal use.) For a small fee, you can also ask a specific HealthTap Medical Expert a question by starting a private health conversation [Conversation].

For a small fee, you can ask a question to a specific Medical Expert on HealthTap. The doctor has a limited period of time to respond. These questions are private (not visible on HealthTap to other members or doctors) and secure. The doctor you ask the question to will be able to see information contained within your Health Activity and can aslo see you real name.
Yes. Unlike publicly visible questions and answers on HealthTap, you can provide Personally Identifiable Information in an Episode question and follow up.

We use personal information collected through HealthTap, including health and wellness information, to enable the services we provide, and as described in this Privacy Statement. This Privacy Statement describes the ways that we use or disclose your information. In support of these uses, we may use personal information to:

Yes. You can edit or delete information in your Health Activity by signing in to your HealthTap account and editing your Health Activity. Once you edit or delete a record, you cannot retrieve it. Information in Private Conversations cannot be deleted.

We use cookies to enable you to sign in and to help personalize HealthTap. Using cookies simplifies the process of delivering relevant content and allows you to retrieve the information you previously provided, so that you can easily use the site's features. We use both session ID cookies and persistent cookies, and all browser Cookies we use are encrypted. We link the information we store in session cookies to personally identifiable information you submit while on our site. You have the ability to accept or decline cookies. Most web browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can usually modify your browser setting to decline some or all cookies if you prefer. If you choose to decline all cookies, you may not be able to use interactive features of this or other web sites that depend on cookies.

HealthTap does not share your Personally Identifiable Information (for example, your real name or email address) with anyone unless you permit it. When you enter into a private health conversation with a doctor on HealthTap for a fee, you permit your Personally Identifiable Information to be made available to this doctor. HealthTap works by helping you find reliable and personalized health information. As part of this service, HealthTap may provide you with information about external service providers (“Service Providers”) that may be of interest or use to you (for example, a health clinic). HealthTap does not provide these external Service Providers with any Personally Identifiable Information about you, without your express consent. Service Providers cannot access your Health Activity or other health and wellness information through HealthTap.

Some members may want to share personal information with a Service Provider. You can always do this on your own. If we allow this in the future, before you share any information with a Service Provider through HealthTap, we will require you to confirm that you agree to any such sharing. As used in this question and answer, “Service Providers” does not include HealthTap Medical Experts.

Yes. By continuing to use HealthTap, you agree to this Privacy Statement and any updates to it. This means that if the Privacy Statement changes, you agree to these changes if you keep using HealthTap. When this policy is changed (other than for typographical corrections that do not change its meaning), we will update the "last modified" date at the top of the policy. We also will provide a summary at the bottom of the policy, describing the types of changes made.

. A HealthTap doctor can help determine if you meet these criteria.

trans-unit.source: most health insurance policies will cover the HCV test at no cost to you*

The CDC and the United States Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) recommend that Baby Boomers (those born 1945–1965) and high-risk individuals get a simple blood test to screen for Hepatitis C Virus (HCV). If left untreated Hepatitis C can cause liver damage, cirrhosis, liver failure, and other medical problems. If you meet screening guidelines,

Affiliate wishes to promote Company’s services (“Affiliate’s Promotion”), described below (“Promoted Services”), and disseminate a customized Affiliate link provided to Affiliate by the company (“Affiliate Link”) to a landing page on the Company’s website and mobile apps (“Company Apps”) through which consumers can pay for the Promoted Services. Affiliate’s Promotion may take place through Affiliate’s website, apps, social media accounts, or other channels (“Affiliate Channels”).

a. Company shall provide Affiliate with a custom Affiliate Link directed to a specific landing page (the “Affiliate Landing Page”) on the Company’s website and/or mobile apps (the “Company Apps”). Affiliate agrees that Affiliate is only entitled to compensation, as further set forth herein, for customer sign ups generated directly from this Affiliate Link.

c. Commissions are held for a period of 2 months from any purchase to protect Company in the event of any chargeback that may occur. Company shall pay all Commissions accrued and payable to Affiliate within fifteen (15) days of the first day of each month after such holdback period (the “Commission Payment Date”). Company may withhold any Commission payments as well as any actual chargeback fees for which the Company is liable that are generated through transactions from sign ups through the Affiliate Link (“Affiliate Chargeback Fees”), from any Commission Payments to Affiliate. If at any time Affiliate’s Commission Payments balance is negative as a result of Affiliate Chargeback Fees, Company may suspend or terminate the Affiliate Link or Affiliate’s participation in the Affiliate Program.

d. If on any Commission Payment Date, the amount of total Commissions accrued and payable to Affiliate is less than $25.00, then such accrued and payable balance shall be held over to the following month, and paid together with the Commissions due for that month. If at any time, the balance of accrued and payable Commissions is held over for 2 consecutive months, then Company shall pay all accrued and payable Commissions to Affiliate in the third month, regardless of the total amount owed. Payment is made via the Affiliate PayPal account or other account permitted by Company. Affiliate is responsible for any payment processing or PayPal fees associated with delivery and receipt of payment and understands and agrees that payments received will be reduced by any such fees..
f. Nothing in this agreement guarantees that Affiliate will be successful or make any money under the program. Affiliate understands that no compensation is guaranteed for any efforts made.

b. Either Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement at any time and for any cause. The Company may terminate this Agreement without notice. The Affiliate must give written notice to Company at least 30 days prior to the intended date of termination.

In payment of the transactional License Fee, the Practice hereby authorizes HealthTap to: (i) collect and deposit, on behalf of the Practice, in a bank account in the name of HealthTap, the consultation fee for the Remote Medical Consultation conducted by the Practice; and (ii) deduct and retain the License Fee from the consultation fee collected by HealthTap prior to payment in full of the annual base (if any) license fee and then remitting to the Practice the remaining portion of the consultation fee for the Remote Medical Consultation. HealthTap Prime provides primary care virtual consults with doctors licensed in your state for limited diagnosis, care and prescriptions (as appropriate). HealthTap Concierge lets you connect with your doctor for viritual consults using the HelathTap platform, or with other doctors for second opinions or one-time consults for minor conditions that can be addressed and resolved, in the sole opinion of the doctor, via a virtual consult. HealthTap Premium Services can be a great resource between doctor visits, but are not a substitute for in person doctor visits, your primary care doctor or your primary care doctor’s independent judgment about any symptom, condition, or the appropriateness or risks of a procedure or treatment for a given person. HealthTap Prime is not health insurance and is not a substitute for health insurance.

“With a newborn child, it’s hard to do anything or go anywhere such as the medical centre. This app save me the time it would take to go to the doctor when it's not necessary. And when I needed advice late at night, HealthTap docs replied quickly and I didn't need to wait till the next day when the doctors are open.“

“My son who's now 12 years old was born with several congenital issues. After several surgeries over the years, he's now a healthy child of 12 years. If I need any help or any tips, I find it on HealthTap, not only for him also for the whole family! It really helps!“

“I wish I had HealthTap Prime when my mom had a stroke and was in a coma. It would've been amazing to get an immediate second opinion instead of paying $1000 out of pocket. My mom was bed-bound, so I had to coordinate doctor appointments for her, find a handicap-accessible van, then suffer the waiting room with her. Now, I can use HealthTap in minutes for a virtual consult.“
“I love having my own private doctor on call, whenever I need him. All it takes is just a few taps on my smartphone. Best of all, I can consult with him via HD video or chat!“

“This app has improved my life vastly. I’ve had more questions than answers for a while now. It’s unreasonable to call my doctor every 5 minutes. The caring and expert doctors have been a lifesaver and brought me so much peace of mind!“

Feel Free to share your professional clinical expertise though answers that are evidence-based and consistent with accepted standards in the medical community. HealthTap is for general questions. Refrain from using language that suggests an answer is provided for a single member. Unless you are in a Private Conversation with a user on HealthTap, refrain from answering questions that solicit your individual opinion as a single Medical Expert. Avoid answering questions or providing answers that suggest a duty of care and a doctor-patient relationship.

means all confidential and proprietary information, whether received orally, in writing, or by or through a product, that is designated as confidential or that reasonably should be understood to be confidential given the nature of the information and the circumstances of disclosure. Conversation Fees collected from Participants will be distributed to Subscriber by check or money transfer (using a service such as PayPal) after both (i) the total of the Subscriber’s Conversation Fees exceeds $100 (each a "Payment Distribution") and (ii) Subscriber request, and such distribution to Subscriber shall be the total of all collected Conversation Fees minus the applicable License and Subscription Fees. Conversation Fees and License and Subscription Fees are subject to adjustment pursuant to HealthTap policies and procedures

Yes. Your use of HealthTap is anonymous. Your real name, date of birth, e-mail address, and other Personally Identifiable Information are not visible on the site to other users. Yes. Your e-mail address is not displayed in your Public Profile, and is never visible to other users on HealthTap. For more information about how we keep your Personally Identifiable information safe and secure, see

Yes. You can edit the data in your Health Activity by changing or deleting it at any time. The changes you make are permanent. You will be asked to confirm any changes or deletions from your Health Activity before they are made final.

Yes, but only if you choose to publicly display this information. Other users see Health Activity data that appears in your Public Profile – but they will never see Personally Identifiable Information about you, such as your real name or e-mail address. You control what information is publicly visible through your Privacy & Sharing tab in your settings. You can limit visibility of information to everyone, connections, or no one.

Yes, but only if you choose to publicly display this information. Other users see Topic and Checklist data that appears in your Public Profile – but they will never see Personally Identifiable Information about you, such as your real name or e-mail address. You can control what information is publicly visible through your Privacy & Sharing tab in your settings. You can limit visibility of information to everyone, connections, or no one.

Every user has a Public Profile. Your Public Profile is how other users will see you on the Site. Your Public Profile is your Public Profile Name, and an image or avatar you choose (your Public Profile Picture). It does not contain any Personally Identifiable Information, unless you put such information in your Public Profile Name or Public Profile Picture. Do not use your real name, picture or any other Personally Identifiable Information in your Public Profile Name and avatar. Each user’s Public Profile is linked to that user’s Health Activity, so that all users on the Site can find similar Public Profiles, and so that we can all share in communal health learning.

As this example shows, some of the information stored in you Health Activity is displayed in your Public Profile. Your real name, and other Personally Identifiable Information, are never shown in your Public Profile (unless you put it there). You can turn off sharing of various site features, including Health Activity sharing, at any time.

Yes. Every user of HealthTap, whether or not the user is a caregiver or care recipient, must have a different account. Currently, a parent may add a separate child’s account through their account.

Yes. You can close your account at any time by signing into your HealthTap account and choosing “Delete Account” from your Account Settings. You will receive an e-mail confirming that your account has been deleted.

Each HealthTap user has a Public Profile. HealthTap allows users to find other people who are similar to them by navigating through the site. Each user's Public Profile contains information that is visible to other users on HealthTap. To protect your identity, your real name or other Personally Identifiable Information is never displayed in your Public Profile.

When one user follows another, the follower will see certain information about the user being followed. This information includes certain updates that the user being followed provides to HealthTap and that appear in the Public Profile of the user being followed.

Yes. Only connected users can send each other messages. If you choose to accept a connection, you will be able to send and receive Messages (through your HealthTap Messages Box) with your Connections.
Yes. You can un-connect from a Connection at any time through your Account Settings.

Yes. After you sign up for HealthTap, we will send you a message welcoming you to our community and thanking you for joining us. After that, HealthTap may occasionally send messages to your HealthTap Messages Box, or to an e-mail address you provide to us. No one likes Spam, we do not send our users Spam, and we have a strict No-Spam policy. As described elsewhere in this Privacy Statement, HealthTap may also send you notifications (which you can turn off) and important messages to the e-mail address listed in your Account Settings.

Yes. Connected users can send each other Messages through the HealthTap message system. Only users who are Connected can exchange Messages. Messages will appear in your HealthTap Messages Box. Additionally, your e-mail address will be used to notify you that you have a message on HealthTap. You can turn off this notifications feature at any time through your Account Settings.

You have jock itch, so buy some OTC Lotrimin cream and use it twice a day for 2 weeks. Keep your groin dry, and your rash should be gone in a couple of weeks.

Itchy, reddened, slightly flaky skin in the groin skin folds can be from jock itch or other causes. Jock itch (tinea cruris) is caused by a fungus germ, and is usually treated with over-the-counter Lotrimin AF cream or with prescription anti-fungal medication from a doctor.

You, a physician applying to or currently providing virtual consults on HealthTap or any physician on whose behalf this Agreement is entered into (“Provider”), agree to designate HealthTap to purchase and maintain malpractice insurance with a minimum annual coverage of one million dollars per incident and three million dollars in aggregate, or HealthTap’s subsequent liability minimums, to cover any acts of malpractice committed during the performance of virtual consults on HealthTap, subject to any limitations specified herein or in the policy (“Insurance”). Generally, the Insurance provides claims-made coverage for medical malpractice claims brought in the U.S., including U.S. claims made by claimants in other countries. The coverage excludes consults or interactions outside of the HealthTap platform, claims brought outside of the U.S., and is not available to Providers with no other means of participating in a Patient Compensation Fund (“PCF”) program if the Provider practices in a state where PCF participation is required. The Insurance is secondary to any other applicable or available insurance policy. Provider agrees to provide to HealthTap or the Insurance carrier, upon request, information related to your medical practice, licensure, or events or circumstances likely to impact coverage eligibility. This agreement is in addition to any other agreements governing use of the HealthTap platform, and any representations and warranties therein. In the event of a claim covered or potentially covered by the Insurance and related to services provided under this Agreement and on or through a HealthTap platform (including the HealthTap website and mobile apps), Provider agrees to comply with the terms required by the Insurance to receive the benefit of coverage and to: (i) cooperate with the investigation, settlement of defense of any claim(s); (ii) immediately send HealthTap copies of any demands, notices, summons or legal papers received in connection with a claim; (iii) notify any other insurer whose coverage is or may be available; (iv) cooperate with the insurer with respect to coordinating any other available or potentially available insurance; (v) provide the insurer with written authorization to (a) obtain records and other information related to the claim, and (b) conduct and control the defense of the Physician in such claim. By opting into this program, Provider agrees that HealthTap may withhold an additional administrative fee for the provision of this service from any payments to Provider. Currently this fee is one dollar ($1) per consult, on top of any other fees applicable to the performance of consults through the HealthTap platform. Provider may opt out of this coverage at any time, but waiting periods may apply to any future request to participate in this program. HealthTap retains the rights to end this program or to end Provider’s participation in this program at any time and for any reason, and shall provide Provider with written notice of any such termination, in which case coverage shall apply to virtual consults up to the date of such termination.
